intro: Nomocharis mairei f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered glorybower, is a unique cultivar of the glorybower plant native to China. It is characterized by its striking white flowers, which contrast sharply with its dark green foliage. The plant belongs to the morning glory family (Convolvulaceae) and is known for its vigorous climbing habit. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. This variety is prized for its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
